etymology.description: Early pictogram depicts an acorn -> borrowed phonetically for 'morning' -> Late bronze inscriptions: semantic 日(日) (rì, 'sun') + phonetic 棗(枣) (zǎo) -> small seal script: 日(日, 'sun') + 甲(甲, 'first') = when the sun first rises -> 'early'
etymology.interpretation: The character evolved from depicting an acorn to incorporating the image of the sun and the concept of 'first,' symbolizing the sun's rise to indicate 'early.' It's a combination of both semantic elements and phonetic borrowing.

examples.chinese: 我今天起床很早(我今天起床很早)。
examples.english: I woke up very early today.

examples.chinese: 他早到办公室(他早到辦公室)，开始了紧张的会议(開始了緊張的會議)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǎo dào bàngōngshì, kāishǐ le jǐnzhāng de huìyì.
examples.english: He arrived at the office early and started a busy meeting.

examples.chinese: 他喜欢早睡(他喜歡早睡)，早起的习惯让他精力充沛(早起的習慣讓他精力充沛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān zǎo shuì, zǎo qǐ de xíguàn ràng tā jīnglì chōngpèi.
examples.english: He likes going to bed early, and his habit of getting up early makes him energetic.
